meanings.definition: Making a long, high-pitched cry or sound, typically as an expression of pain or sorrow.
meanings.sent1: The baby was wailing loudly in the night.
meanings.sent2: She heard a cat wailing outside her window.
meanings.sent3: The wailing of the wind made the night seem eerie.
meanings.sent4: The ambulance siren wailed through the city streets.
meanings.sent5: The wailing of the mourners echoed through the church.

meanings.definition: A prolonged high-pitched sound or cry.
meanings.sent1: The wailing of the sirens filled the air.
meanings.sent2: The haunting wailing could be heard from afar.
meanings.sent3: The wailing of the violin added a melancholic touch to the music.
meanings.sent4: The wailing of the tea kettle signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent5: The wailing of the coyotes pierced the silence of the night.
